source.p: To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

td.a: Lena Winslow April Board of Education Meeting-Online
td.br: The Lena Winslow board of Education will be conducting their monthly meeting on April 28, 2020. The meeting will be held online through Google Meet to comply with the stay at home order and social distancing recommendations. If you would like to attend the meeting electronically, please email Darcy Schierloh at schierlohd@le-win.net and she will send you an invitation.
Clink the link to read the letter for new dates for Graduation 2020 and Prom

td.a: Lunch and Breakfast served through May 22nd
td.br: The school district will continue to provide lunch and breakfast through the last student attendance day of this school year which is May 22, 2020. Any student may participate at no cost to the family. It is grab and go and served between 11 am and 1 pm. You can pick up the meals in the entry to the elementary gym. If you would like to be added to the list please email Dawn at spinhirned@le-win.net or Sherri at ackersons@le-win.net or just stop in between 11am and 1 pm.

td.a: Band & Choir Students that sold Butterbraids-Delivery Scheduled
td.br:
Butterbraid pick up will be on Monday, April 27 from 4:00-5:30pm at the Elementary Cafeteria entrance (behind the junior high).
NOTE: This pick-up is for the students who sold Butterbraids, who will in turn contact and distribute the product to the people who ordered from them.
We will be running a drive thru pick up to minimize contact. Please pull up to the entrance, remain in your car and give us your name from your car. We will bring your order out and load it into the trunk or back end of your vehicle and you will be set to go.
As a reminder all orders must be picked up at this time as we have no access to freezer space to store your items for you. Thank you all for your understanding and patience in getting your Butterbraid orders to you. Thank you to everyone who sold Butterbraids and made this a very successful fundraiser!
Unfortunately, the music department's summer of 2020 trip has been cancelled due to COVID-19 pandemic. Please see the attached letter from the Le-Win Music Boosters.
See attached flyer for details. Yearbooks will be delivered in the fall.

td.a: ELEMENTARY PARTIAL ROOF REPLACEMENT-INVITATION TO BID
td.br: Please click on the link to see the invitation to bid which includes pre-bid conference date and time as well as bid dates and bid specifics. Pre bid meeting is April 20, 2020 at 1:30 pm at 401 Fremont. Social distancing will be in place.

td.a: Show your support for our student-athletes
td.br: The coronavirus pandemic has brought many aspects of life to a halt, including athletics and other extra-curricular activities. To shine a light on all of those students that are missing out not only on their activities, but also their school time with friends and teachers, Lena-Winslow will participate in the "Be The Light" movement. To show our support for all those students affected, the lights at the Lena-Winslow HS Football Field will be turned on tonight, April 10 at 8PM for 1 Hour. Our scoreboard will be lit up to display support for this year's class of 2020. We remind anyone that happens to come by the field to remain in your vehicle and to observe social distancing.

img.br: Hometown Embroidery & Hometown Trophies-Gifts & Engraving and the Le-Win Schools are partnering to create a t-shirt to signify our community's togetherness during this difficult time

td.br: If you have been having issues receiving text messages from the school, then please text YES to 67587.
Everyone, please stay safe. We miss you and want you to be safe so we can see you again in the future! Check out our video...
Remote Learning to continue through April 30th.
Governor Pritzker has issued a directive to postpone school.

As of today, March 13th, the following events have been canceled involving LWHS: 3/17 HS Track at Byron. 3/17 HS Baseball and Softball vs Eastland. 3/19 Baseball and Softball at Stillman Valley. 3/20 Conference Music Festival at Dakota. 3/21 HS Baseball and Softball vs Polo. 3/21 HS Track at Platteville. 3/23 HS Softball vs Boylan. 3/24 Baseball and Softball vs Galena. 3/26 HS Softball vs Freeport. 3/26 HS Baseball vs Milledgeville. 3/28 HS Baseball and Softball vs AFC. 3/30. 3/31 HS Baseball and Softball vs Juda. 4/3 & 4/4 HS Softball Tournament at Orangeville. Any additional cancellations will be made public if and when they happen.

Due to the outbreak of the coronavirus, the 8th grade trip to Washington DC, scheduled for March 21-23, has been postponed. The trip will be rescheduled for sometime later this spring. Once the new dates have been confirmed, the information will be released to all involved. If you have any questions contact Mr. Smargiassi at smargiassit@le-win.net
The Depot Stove Gang Train Show scheduled for this weekend at the school has been cancelled.
